results.title: The Little world of Dietmar Fill
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray, John Shaw and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: The late Dietmar Fill has been accorded many honours for his remarkable natural science films and his micro-photography. This series draws together the best of his work, giving us an insight into his film-making techniques and letting us meet the man.

results.title: The Little vampire
results.creator_credit: Vampire Productions, Richard Klaus and Uli Edel
results.brief_description: An only child receives a change of lifestyle when his father builds a golf course at the place where it all started, Scotland. Young Tony (Jonathan Lipnicki) is bullied at school, has a recurring dream about vampires and is miserable and without friends. His dreams prove founded when he is visited by a young boy from his dreams who turns out to be a vampire. Weak and unable to fly, Rudolph is taken care of by Tony who cares for the ailing bloodsucker and the two become friends. Tony educates Rudolph (Rollo Weeks) in the mores of life in the 21st century and Rudolph shares his life story - his family, the Sackville-Baggs are part of a vampire community cursed as lost souls until a powerful amulet can be restored to lift the curse. Tony joins the quest, even though it will mean losing the circle of friends he has found in the process. Based on the novels by Angela Sommer-Bodenburg. Cast also includes Richard E Grant, Jim Carter, Alice Krige and Anna Popplewell.

results.title: The Little shop of horrors [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Filmgroup, American International Pictures (AIP) and Roger Corman
results.brief_description: Originally a film directed by Roger Corman and shot in two days in 1960, then a musical play extravaganza on Broadway in 1982, and finally a multimillion dollar allstar film musical in 1986, “Little shop of horrors,” with its quirkiness, comedy and wonderful satire has developed quite a cult following over the decades. This original version features Jonathan Haze as the nerdy Seymour Krelborn who works in the florist shop near Skid Row, Mel Welles as Mushnik his boss, and Jackie Joseph as Audrey, the shop assistant and woman Seymour secretly desires. When Seymour buys a small exotic plant which suddenly appeared after an eclipse of the sun, strange things begin to happen. Audrey II (Seymour’s name for the plant) takes on a personality of its own and develops quite a unique appetite, wanting to be continually fed, not with plant food, but with blood, and the more it is fed, the bigger Audrey II becomes. This monster plant has an insatiable appetite and the dilemma for Seymour is what can he do about it. Features a cameo by Jack Nicholson in his first motion picture performance as the demented dentist. The legendary Roger Corman made this movie in days and it has more laughs than most big budget films.

results.title: The Little shop of horrors
results.creator_credit: The Geffen Company, David Geffen and Frank Oz
results.brief_description: Originally a film directed by Roger Corman and shot in two days in 1960, then a musical play extravaganza on Broadway in 1982, and finally a multimillion dollar allstar film musical in 1986, “Little shop of horrors,” with its quirkiness, comedy and wonderful satire has developed quite a cult following over the decades. This extremely entertaining version by puppeteer and director Frank Oz (The Dark crystal, The Muppets take Manhattan, Dirty rotten scoundrels, The Empire strikes back [voice of Yoda], Return of the Jedi, The Phantom menace) features Rick Moranis as the nerdy Seymour Krelborn who works in the florist shop near Skid Row, Vincent Gardenia as Mushnik his boss, and Ellen Greene as Audrey, the shop assistant and woman Seymour secretly desires. When Seymour buys a small exotic plant which suddenly appeared after an eclipse of the sun, strange things begin to happen. Audrey II (Seymour’s name for the plant) takes on a personality of its own and develops quite a unique appetite, wanting to be continually fed, not with plant food, but with blood, and the more it is fed, the bigger Audrey II becomes. This monster plant has an insatiable appetite and the dilemma for Seymour is what can he do about it. Nominated for many awards (including Academy Awards, Golden Globe, BAFTA) and winner of the Saturn Award for Best Music (Alan Menken) in the Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy and Horror Films, 1987. Uses great visual and special effects, with book, lyrics and screenplay by Howard Ashman, music by Alan Menken, music produced by Bob Gaudio, and voice of Audrey II performed by Levi Stubbs of The Four Tops. Cameo roles by Steve Martin (at his brilliant best as the totally demented and sadistic bikie boyfriend of Audrey), James Belushi, Bill Murray, John Candy, Christopher Guest and an excellent support cast including Tichina Arnold, Tisha Campbell and Michelle Weeks.

results.title: The Little ships of England
results.brief_description: A study of boatbuilding in Britain, tracing the processes of the industry from the oak, ash, and elm forests, to the boat and shipbuilding yards. The film includes a sequence dealing with the part played by little ships in the evacuation of Dunkirk, World War II.

results.title: The Little red lighthouse
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: Story film for children. Uses the pictures and text of the book by Hildegarde Swift and Lyn Ward to tell about the little lighthouse whose existence is threatened by the building of the George Washington Bridge across the Hudson River.

results.title: The Little rascals
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, King World, Michael King, Bill Oakes, Gerald Molen and Penelope Spheeris
results.brief_description: Spanky, Alfalfa, and the other ‘little rascals’ made famous in the Hal Roach ‘Our Gang’ shorts of the 1920s and 1930s, test the boundaries of friendship when Alfalfa falls head over heels for Darla. As a member of the “He-Man Womun Haters Club’, Alfalfa has sworn to hate women, and must hide his crush. A task he believes will be simple, as the boys are focused on the upcoming go-cart derby, and their prize-winning go-cart ‘The Blur’. Unfortunately Alfalfa’s best friend and club president Spanky discovers his friend has breached the number one club rule, and attempts to sabotage the relationship before it begins, starting a chain reaction of comical mistakes and misunderstandings. Features cameos by Whoopi Goldberg, Donald Trump, Mel Brooks, Daryl Hannah and Reba McEntire.

results.title: The Little princess (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck and Walter Lang
results.brief_description: A charming story set in Victorian England stars Shirley Temple. When her widower father, an army officer, is sent off to the Boer War, Shirley is placed in a boarding school. When he is reported killed, the mean headmistress relegates Shirley to being a servant. She suffers her indignities bravely until her shell shocked father returns. The film contains a famous dream ballet in which Shirley is crowned a princess, plus several dazzling song and dance numbers performed with Arthur Treacher. Based on the novel by Frances Hodgson Burnett.
